definition[0]: small, but arranged so that everything fits neatly into the space available – used to show approval
example[0]: The compact design of the machine allows it to be stored easily.
example[1]: The students’ rooms were compact, with a desk, bed, and closet built in.
definition[1]: packed or put together firmly and closely
example[2]: The bushes grew in a compact mass.
definition[3]: a small flat container with a mirror, containing powder for a woman’s face
definition[6]: an agreement between countries or people
example[4]: A compact was negotiated between the company and the union.
definition[7]: to press something together so that it becomes smaller or more solid
